test_cases.expected_result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.
Login is rejected and an appropriate error message is displayed without revealing which field was incorrect.
Access to 'Customs' module is denied and an error or access-denied message is displayed.
System prevents the same user from approving a bill they initiated, enforcing SoD rules.
Password input is masked and not visible in clear text.
All data transmission, especially login credentials, is performed over HTTPS (TLS), with no plain HTTP allowed.
Input is sanitized and an error message is displayed. No database changes or leaks occur.
System rejects the input and displays a validation error. No script execution occurs.
Bulk approval option is not available or is disabled for the user.
System blocks the transaction and displays an error indicating the daily corporate limit has been exceeded.
User session expires and user is redirected to the login page.
Audit trail correctly logs group, status, action by, action on, and remarks for each workflow step.
System rejects non-compliant characters and displays an appropriate validation error.
System prevents selection or usage of accounts outside the user's entitlement.
Account is temporarily locked or CAPTCHA is triggered after a threshold of failed login attempts.
Receipt contains only necessary information and no sensitive data (e.g., passwords, internal IDs) is leaked.
All payment actions (initiate, verify, approve, release) are disabled or hidden for the user.
System displays error messages for each mandatory field left blank, and prevents submission.
System prevents any modification or deletion of audit trail entries; audit logs are immutable.
Access is denied and no data from Corporate B is exposed to the user from Corporate A.
System rejects the input and displays a descriptive validation error.
Release action is not available or is disabled for the user.
System rejects the input and prompts user to enter the date in DD-MM-YYYY format.
Virtual accounts are not selectable or visible to the user.
Session reuse from a different device/IP is blocked, and user is prompted to login again.
Transaction is auto-rejected and status is updated accordingly; audit trail reflects the auto-rejection event.
Portal displays fees returned by eFinance API and calculates total payment amount correctly.
Portal displays an error to the user indicating fee retrieval failed and prevents payment initiation.
Account details are correctly fetched and displayed; only accounts entitled to the user are shown.
Access is denied; portal displays authorization error per entitlement configuration.
Workflow API receives both approvals in sequence and updates payment status accordingly.
Payment status updates to 'Approved' once all required approvals are received, regardless of order.
Payment is successfully reflected in core banking system and status updated to 'Processed'.
Portal displays an error, payment status remains 'Approved', and system logs the failure for retry.
Each workflow action is logged with correct user, timestamp, status, and remarks in audit logs.
API correctly enforces access, allowing transactions from only those accounts user is entitled to.
All selected payments are verified in one API call and status updated accordingly.
Bulk approval fails for invalid payment; valid payments are approved, and error is reported for failure.
API rejects approval attempt, displaying SoD violation error.
Transaction status is auto-updated to 'Rejected' and audit log records auto-rejection.
API rejects request with specific error for non-compliant characters.
API rejects request with error message indicating missing mandatory field.
Payments exceeding limit are rejected, and user is notified of limit breach.
API allows self-approval as amount is within permitted threshold.
API rejects self-approval attempt and enforces need for another approver.
API returns receipt in Arabic, with all fields correctly localized.
API returns downloadable/printable receipt in correct format; action is logged in the audit trail.
API rejects request and returns error specifying the required DD-MM-YYYY format.
All workflow steps are logged with regulatory-required fields for auditability.
API denies request and returns authorization error.
All selected payments are released in a single API call and statuses updated accordingly.
System handles concurrent API calls without data corruption or performance degradation; all actions are properly logged.

test_cases.expected_result: System displays a clear error message indicating the 'Taxpayer ID' field is required, prevents submission, and logs the validation failure with user and timestamp.
System displays a user-friendly error message stating 'Fee retrieval failed, please try again later', disables further payment steps, and logs the API error with relevant details.
System detects the invalid date format, prompts with an appropriate error message, and does not proceed to the next step. The error is logged for audit.
System blocks the approval action, displays an error indicating SoD violation, and logs the unauthorized attempt.
System approves only valid payments, displays errors for invalid ones, and logs both successful and failed actions with detailed reasons.
System prevents the release, displays an 'Account limit exceeded' error, and logs the event for audit and compliance.
System rejects the entry, highlights the invalid characters, displays a compliance error, and logs the attempt.
System shows a descriptive error message to the user, marks payment as 'Submission Failed', allows retry or escalation, and logs the integration failure with all technical details.
System automatically rejects the payment, updates the status, and records a detailed audit log with timestamp, reason, and system action.
System prompts the user to re-login, preserves unsaved approval action if possible, and logs the session timeout event.
System denies access, displays an 'Unauthorized access' error, and logs the unauthorized access attempt for security audit.
System displays an error specifying which payment types are not entitled for the selected account, aborts the operation, and logs the entitlement mismatch.

test_cases.description: Verify that all steps in the governmental payment initiation and approval workflow are fully navigable and operable using only the keyboard.
Ensure that all error and validation messages on the payment form are accessible and announced by screen readers.
Verify that generated payment receipts are accessible and properly formatted in both English and Arabic, supporting screen readers and correct logical reading order.
Validate that the bulk approval interface for bills supports accessibility, including keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and accessible selection of multiple items.
Verify the system's ability to handle a large number of simultaneous governmental payment initiations and approvals by multiple corporate users.
Assess the system's scalability and stability when a large number of entitlement changes are performed concurrently by multiple administrators.
Test the system's ability to efficiently process bulk verification and approval workflows when a batch contains both valid and invalid governmental payment transactions.
Evaluate system scalability when a peak number of approved governmental payment transactions are submitted to the core banking system via APIs.
